input: Do you guys know about the Putnam?
It's a math competition for undergraduate students.
from_community_srt: Znate li išta o Putnamu? To je matematičko natjecanje za preddiplomske studente.

input: It's a six-hour long test that just has 12 questions broken up into two different three-hour sessions.
from_community_srt: To je test koji traje 6 sati i ima samo 12 pitanja rastavljena u dvije trosatne sesije.

input: And each one of those questions is scored 1 to 10, so the highest possible score would be 120.
from_community_srt: Svako pitanje je bodovano od 1 do 10. Stoga je najveći mogući broj bodova 120.

input: And yet, despite the fact that the only students taking this thing each year are those who clearly are already pretty interested in math, the median score is around 1 or 2.
from_community_srt: Ipak, iako su jedini studenti koji polažu ovo svake godine oni koje očito već zanima matematika, Prosječni broj bodova obično bude oko 1 ili 2.

input: So it's a hard test.
from_community_srt: Tako da... to je težak test.

input: And on each one of those sections of six questions, the problems tend to get harder as you go from 1 to 6, although of course difficulty is in the eye of the beholder.
from_community_srt: I na oba ta dijela od po 6 pitanja, problemi budu sve teži kako idete od 1 do 6, iako je, naravno, težina u oku promatrača.

input: But the thing about those fives and sixes is that even though they're positioned as the hardest problems on a famously hard test, quite often these are the ones with the most elegant solutions available, some subtle shift in perspective that transforms it from very challenging to doable.
from_community_srt: Ali stvar s tim 5. i 6. pitanjima je ta da iako su stavljeni kao najteži problemi na  poznatom teškom testu vrlo često su ti problemi oni s najelegantnijim rješenjima Neki suptilni pomak u perspektivi koji ga transformira od vrlo izazovnog do izvodljivog.

input: Here I'm going to share with you one problem that came up as the sixth question on one of these tests a while back.
from_community_srt: Ovdje ću s vama podjeliti jedan problem koji se nalazio kao šesto pitanje jednog ovakvog testa.

input: And those of you who follow the channel know that rather than just jumping straight to the solution, which in this case would be surprisingly short, when possible I like to take the time to walk you through how you might have stumbled across the solution yourself, where the insight comes from.
from_community_srt: Oni od vas koji prate ovaj kanal znaju da umjesto da vam odmah kažem rješenje, koje bi, u ovom slučaju, bilo iznenađujuće kratko; Kada je to moguće, želim uzeti vrijeme i pokazati vam na koji biste način vi sami mogli doći do rješenja, otkuda uvid dolazi.

input: That is, make a video more about the problem-solving process than about the problem used to exemplify it.
from_community_srt: To znači, napraviti video koji je više o procesu rješavanja problema nego o problemu uzetom za primjer.

input: So anyway, here's the question.
from_community_srt: U svakom slučaju,

input: If you choose four random points on a sphere, and consider the tetrahedron with these points as its vertices, what is the probability that the center of the sphere is inside that tetrahedron?
from_community_srt: evo pitanja: ako odaberete 4 nasumične točke na sferi, i razmotrite tetraedar čiji su vrhovi te točke, kolika je vjerojatnost da centar te sfere bude  unutar tetraedra?

input: Go ahead, take a moment and kind of digest this question.
from_community_srt: Uzmite si trenutak da "probavite" ovo pitanje.

input: You might start thinking about which of these tetrahedra contain the sphere's center, which ones don't, how you might systematically distinguish the two, and how do you approach a problem like this?
from_community_srt: Mogli biste početi razmišljati o tome koji od ovih tetraedara sadržavaju sferin centar, a koji ne te kako biste mogli sistematski razlikovati to dvoje. I kako uopće pristupiti ovakvom problemu? Otkud uopće početi?

input: Where do you even start?

Well, it's usually a good idea to think about simpler cases, so let's knock things down to two dimensions, where you'll choose three random points on a circle, and it's always helpful to name things so let's call these guys P1, P2, and P3.
from_community_srt: Obično je dobra ideja razmisliti o jednostavnijim slučajevima. Stoga, idemo problem suziti na dvije dimenzije gdje ćete birati tri nasumične točke na kružnici. Uvijek je korisno imenovati stvari, pa hajdemo ih nazvati P1, P2 i P3.

input: The question is, what's the probability that the triangle formed by these points contains the center of the circle?
from_community_srt: Pitanje je kolika je vjerojatnost da će trokut definiran ovim točkama sadržavati centar kružnice.

input: I think you'll agree it's way easier to visualize now, but it's still a hard question.
from_community_srt: Mislim da ćete se složiti da se problem puno lakše vizualizira sada, no, ovo je još uvijek teško pitanje.

input: So again, you ask, is there a way to simplify what's going on, get ourselves to some kind of foothold that we can build up from?
from_community_srt: Pa biste se opet mogli zapitati: postoji li način da pojednostavimo što se događa, da si izgradimo nekakav oslonac od kojeg možemo dalje raditi.

input: Well, maybe you imagine fixing P1 and P2 in place, and only letting that third point vary.
from_community_srt: Možda zamislite fiksiranje P1 i P2 i dopuštanje samo trećoj točki da se giba.

input: And when you do this, and play around with it in your mind, you might notice that there's a special region, a certain arc, where when P3 is in that arc, the triangle contains the center, otherwise not.
from_community_srt: Kada ovo napravite i igrate se time u svojem umu možete primjetiti da postoji posebno područje, određeni luk. Ako taj luk sadrži P3, trokut sadrži centar, inače ne.

input: Specifically, if you draw lines from P1 and P2 through the center, these lines divide up the circle into four different arcs, and if P3 happens to be in the one on the opposite side as P1 and P2, the triangle has the center.
from_community_srt: Posebno, ako povučete linije od P1 i od P2 kroz centar, ove linije dijele kružnicu u 4 različita luka. Ako se dogodi da je P3 u luku nasuprot P1 i P2, trokut sadrži centar.

input: If it's in any of the other arcs though, no luck.
from_community_srt: Ali ako je u bilo kojem drugom luku, nemate sreće.

input: We're assuming here that all of the points of the circle are equally likely.
from_community_srt: Ovdje pretpostavljamo da su sve točke kružnice jednako vjerojatne.

input: So what is the probability that P3 lands in that arc?
It's the length of that arc divided by the full circumference of the circle, the proportion of the circle that this arc makes up.
from_community_srt: Koja je onda vjerojatnost da se P3 nalazi u tom luku? To je duljina tog luka podjeljena opsegom kružnice, proporcija kružnice koju čini ovaj luk.

input: So what is that proportion?
Obviously that depends on where you put the first two points.
from_community_srt: Kolika je onda ta proporcija? Naravno ona ovisi o tome gdje staviti prve dvije točke.

input: I mean, if they're 90 degrees apart from each other, then the relevant arc is one quarter of the circle.
from_community_srt: Ako su 90 stupnjeva udaljene jedna do druge, onda je relevantni luk 1/4 kružnice.

input: But if those two points were farther apart, that proportion would be something closer to a half, and if they were really close together, that proportion gets closer to zero.
from_community_srt: Ali ako su te dvije točke više udaljene, Ta proporcija je bliža 1/2. A ako su jako blizu jedna drugoj, ta proporcija  je bliža nuli.

input: So think about this for a moment.
from_community_srt: Razmislite na trenutak.

input: P1 and P2 are chosen randomly, with every point on the circle being equally likely.
from_community_srt: P1 i P2 su odabrane nasumično, svaka točka je jednako vjerojatna.

input: So what is the average size of this relevant arc?
Maybe you imagine fixing P1 in place, and just considering all the places that P2 might be.
from_community_srt: Što je prosječna veličina relevantnog luka? Možda zamislite fiksiranje P1 i uzimanje u obzir gdje bi P2 mogla biti.

input: All of the possible angles between these two lines, every angle from 0 degrees up to 180 degrees, is equally likely.
from_community_srt: Svi mogući kutevi između ove dvije linije, svi kutevi od 0° do 180° su jednako vjerojatni.

input: So every proportion between 0 and 0.5 is equally likely, and that means that the average proportion is 0.25.
from_community_srt: Svaka proporcija između 0 i 0.5 je jednako vjerojatna. I to znači da je prosječna proporcija 0.25.

input: So, if the average size of this arc is a quarter of the full circle, the average probability that the third point lands in it is a quarter, and that means that the overall probability that our triangle contains the center is a quarter.
from_community_srt: Ako je prosječna veličina ovog luka 1/4 punog kruga, Prosječna vjerojatnost da će treća točka biti u njemu je 1/4. A to znači da je cjelokupna vjerojatnost da naš trokut sadrži centar jednaka 1/4.

input: But can we extend this into the three-dimensional case?
If you imagine three out of those four points just being fixed in place, which points of the sphere can the fourth one be on so that the tetrahedron that they form contain the center of the sphere?
from_community_srt: Ali što ako ovaj problem proširimo u tri dimenzije? Ako zamislite da su 3 od tih 4 točaka fiksirane, u kojim točkama sfere može biti četvrta tako da tetraedar koje one formiraju sadrži centar sfere?

input: Just like before, let's go ahead and draw some lines from each of those fixed three points through the center of the sphere.
from_community_srt: Kao i prije, idemo povući linije od svake od tih tri točaka kroz centar sfere.

input: It's also helpful if we draw some planes that are determined by any pair of these lines.
from_community_srt: Ovdje je također korisno ako nacrtamo ravnine koje su određene bilo kojim parom ovih linija.

input: What these planes do, you might notice, is divide the sphere into eight different sections, each of which is a sort of spherical triangle.
from_community_srt: Što sada ove ravnine rade, možete primjetiti, jest da podjele sferu u 8 različitih dijelova, svaki od kojih je nekakav sferični trokut.

input: And our tetrahedron is only going to contain the center of the sphere if the fourth point is in the spherical triangle on the opposite side as the first three.
from_community_srt: Naš tetraedar će samo sadržavati centar sfere ako je 4. točka u sferičnom trokutu koji je nasuprot prvih tri točaka.

input: Now, unlike the 2D case, it's pretty difficult to think about the average size of this section, as we let the initial three points vary.
from_community_srt: Za razliku od 2D slučaja, vrlo je teško misliti o prosječnoj veličini ovog dijela ako pustimo tri točke da variraju.

input: Those of you with some multivariable calculus under your belt might think, let's just try a surface integral.
from_community_srt: Oni od vas sa znanjem kalkulusa s više varijabli bi mogli reći: hajdemo pokušati s površinskim integralom.

input: And by all means, pull out some paper and give it a try.
from_community_srt: I svakako, uzmite si nešto papira i pokušajte.

input: But it's not easy.
from_community_srt: Ali to nije lako.

input: And of course it should be difficult.
from_community_srt: I naravno, trebalo bi biti teško.

input: I mean, this is the sixth problem on a Putnam, what do you expect?
from_community_srt: Ipak je ovo šesti problem na Putnamu,

input: And what do you even do with that?
from_community_srt: što očekujete? I...

input: Well, one thing you can do is back up to the two-dimensional case and contemplate if there is a different way to think about the same answer we got.
from_community_srt: što uopće napravite s tim? Jedna stvar koji možete napraviti jest vratiti se na 2D slučaj, i promisliti postoji li drugačiji način dobivanja istog riješenja.

input: That answer, one-fourth, looks suspiciously clean, and raises the question of what that four represents.
from_community_srt: Odgovor "1/4" izgleda sumnjivo čisto te postavlja pitanje o tome što ta četvorka predstavlja.

input: One of the main reasons I wanted to make a video about this particular problem is that what's about to happen carries with it a broader lesson for mathematical problem solving.
from_community_srt: Jedan od glavnih razloga što sam htio napraviti video o ovome jest taj da što će se upravo dogoditi nosi sa sobom širu lekciju za rješavanje matematičkih problema.

input: Think about those two lines we drew for p1 and p2 through the origin.
from_community_srt: Promislite o tim dvijema linijama koje smo povukli za P1 ili P2 kroz centar.

input: They made the problem a lot easier to think about.
from_community_srt: Oni čine problem puno lakšim za razmatranje.

input: And in general, whenever you've added something to the problem setup that makes it conceptually easier, see if you can reframe the entire question in terms of those things you just added.
from_community_srt: I generalno, kad god dodate nešto postavljenom problemu koji ga čini konceptualno lakšim, vidite možete li postaviti čitavi problem kroz te stvari koje ste dodali.

input: In this case, rather than choosing three points randomly, start by saying, choose two random lines that pass through the circle's center.
from_community_srt: U ovom slučaju, umjesto da nastojimo izabrati tri točke nasumično, počnimo ovako:

input: For each line, there's two possible points it could correspond to, so just flip a coin for each one to choose which of the endpoints is going to be p1, and likewise for the other, which endpoint is going to be p2.
from_community_srt: odaberite dvije nasumične linije koje prolaze kroz  centar kružnice; za svaku liniju postoje dvije moguće točke koje bi odgovarale, stoga bacite novčić za svaku krajnju točku kako biste odabrali koja će biti P1; Na isti način, za drugu liniju odaberiti koja će krajnja točka biti P2.

input: Choosing a random line and flipping a coin like this is the same thing as choosing a random point on the circle, it just feels a little bit convoluted at first.
from_community_srt: Izabiranje nasumične linije i bacanje novčića na ovaj način je ista stvar kao i odabiranje nasumične  točke na kružnici. Samo se na prvu čini složeno.

input: But the reason for thinking about the random process this way is that things are actually about to become easier.
from_community_srt: Ali povod razmišljanju o nasumičnom procesu na ovaj način jest taj da će stvari uskoro postati puno lakše.

input: We'll still think about that third point, p3, as just being a random point on the circle, but imagine that it was chosen before you do the two coin flips.
from_community_srt: Još uvijek ćemo zamisliti tu treću točku P3 kao nasumičnu točku na kružnici. Ali zamislite da je odabrana prije nego što ste bacili novčić.

input: Once the two lines and the third point are set in stone, there's only four possibilities for where p1 and p2 might end up, based on those coin flips, each one being equally likely.
from_community_srt: Jer vidite, jednom kad su dvije linije i treća točka determinirane, Postoje samo četiri mogućnosti za to gdje će se P1 i P2 nalaziti. Svaka od mogućnosti je jednako vjerojatna.

input: But one and only one of those four outcomes leaves p1 and p2 on the opposite side of the circle as p3, with the triangle they form containing the center.
from_community_srt: Ali samo jedan od tih četiri ishoda stavlja P1 i P2 na suprotnu stranu kružnice od P3 Trokut koji one definiraju sadržava centar.

input: So no matter where those two lines end up, and where that p3 ends up, it's always a 1 fourth chance that the coin flips leave us with a triangle containing the center.
from_community_srt: Bez obzira gdje se te dvije linije nalaze i gdje se P3 nalazi, uvijek je vjerojatnost da ćemo dobiti trokut koji sadrži centar 1/4.

input: Now that's very subtle.
from_community_srt: To je vrlo suptilno.

input: Just by reframing how we think about the random process for choosing points, the answer 1 quarter popped out in a very different way from how it did before.
from_community_srt: Promjenom načina na koji razmišljamo o nasumičnom procesu biranja točaka, odgovor 1/4 je proizašao na puno drugačiji način od onoga prije.

input: And importantly, this style of argument generalizes seamlessly up into three dimensions.
from_community_srt: I što je najvažnije, ovaj se stil argumenta besprijekorno generalizira u tri dimenzije.

input: Again, instead of starting off by picking four random points, imagine choosing three random lines through the center of the sphere, and then some random point for p4.
from_community_srt: Ponovno, umjesto biranja četiri nasumične točke, zamislite odabiranje tri nasumične linije  kroz centar sfere, i onda neku nasumičnu točku za P4.

input: That first line passes through the sphere at two points, so flip a coin to decide which of those two points is going to be p1.
from_community_srt: Ta prva linija prolazi kroz sferu u dvije točke, stoga bacite novčić da odaberete koja od tih dviju točaka će biti P1.

input: Likewise, for each of the other lines, flip a coin to decide where p2 and p3 end up.
from_community_srt: Na isti način, za sve ostale linije, bacite novčić da odlučite gdje će se P2 i P3 nalaziti.

input: There's eight equally likely outcomes of those coin flips, but one and only one of them is going to place p1, p2, and p3 on the opposite side of the center as p4.
from_community_srt: Sada postoje osam jednako vjerojatnih ishoda ovih bacanja novčića, ali samo jedan  od njih će staviti P1, P2 i P3 na suprotnu stranu od P4.

input: So one and only one of these eight equally likely outcomes gives us a tetrahedron that contains the center.
from_community_srt: Tako će samo jedan od ovih osam jednako vjerojatnih ishoda proizvesti tetraedar koji sadržava centar.

input: Again, it's kind of subtle how that pops out to us, but isn't that elegant?
from_community_srt: Opet, malo je suptilan način na koji nam se to ukaže; ali nije li elegantno?

input: This is a valid solution to the problem, but admittedly the way I've stated it so far rests on some visual intuition.
from_community_srt: Ovo je važeće rješenje problema, Doduše, način na koji sam ga izrekao se oslanja na vizualnu intuiciju.

input: If you're curious about how you might write it up in a way that doesn't rely on visual intuition, I've left a link in the description to one such write-up in the language of linear algebra, if you're curious.
from_community_srt: Ako vas zanima kako biste to zapisali bez da se oslanjate na vizualnu intuiciju, Ostavio sam link u opisu videa na jedno takvo rješenje u jeziku linearne algebre.

input: And this is pretty common in math, where having the key insight and understanding is one thing, but having the relevant background to articulate that understanding more formally is almost a separate muscle entirely, one that undergraduate math students kind of spend most of their time building up.
from_community_srt: Ovo je vrlo često u matematici, gdje imati ključni uvid i razumijevanje je jedna stvar, ali imati relevantnu pozadinu za formalniju artikulaciju tog razumijevanja je gotovo potpuno drugačiji mišić, jedan koji preddiplomski studenti matematike provedu cijeli svoji život ojačavajući.

input: But the main takeaway here is not the solution itself, but how you might find that key insight if it was put in front of you and you were just left to solve it.
from_community_srt: Ali glavna stvar ovdje nije samo rješenje, već kako biste mogli naći taj ključni uvid ako je stavljen pred vas i morate ga riješiti.

input: Namely, just keep asking simpler versions of the question until you can get some kind of foothold.
from_community_srt: Naime, samo nastavljajte postavljate jednostavnije verzije pitanja dok ne dobijete nekakav oslonac.

input: And then when you do, if there's any kind of added construct that proves to be useful, see if you can reframe the whole question around that new construct.
from_community_srt: I onda kada ga dobijete, ako možete nešto konstruirati što ispadne korisno, probajte postaviti cijeli problem kroz tu konstrukciju.

input: To close things off here, I've got another probability puzzle, one that comes from this video sponsor, brilliant.org.
from_community_srt: Da ovdje završim, imam drugu zagonetku s vjerojatnostima, jednu koja dolazi od sponzora ovog videa- Brilliant.org

input: Suppose you have eight students sitting in a circle taking the Putnam.
from_community_srt: Pretpostavite da imate osam studenata koji sjede u krug i rješavaju Putnam.

input: It's a hard test, so each student tries to cheat off of his neighbor, choosing randomly which neighbor to cheat from.
from_community_srt: To je težak test, pa svaki student nastoji prepisati od svojeg susjeda, nasumično birajući od kojeg će susjeda prepisati.

input: Now circle all of the students that don't have somebody cheating off of their test.
from_community_srt: Sada zaokružite sve studente od kojih nitko ne prepisuje.

input: What is the expected number of such circled students?
from_community_srt: Koji je očekivani broj takvih studentata? Zanimljivo pitanje,

input: It's an interesting question, right?
Brilliant.org is a site where you can practice your problem solving abilities with questions like this and many, many more.
from_community_srt: zar ne? Brilliant.org je stranica gdje možete vježbati vašu sposobnost rješavanja problema poput ovih i mnogih drugih,

input: And that really is the best way to learn.
from_community_srt: a to je stvarno najbolji način učenja.

input: You're going to find countless interesting questions curated in a pretty thoughtful way so that you really do come away better at problem solving.
from_community_srt: Naći ćete bezbroj zanimljivih pitanja selektiranih na vrlo obazriv način tako da stvarno otiđete sa boljom sposobnošću rješavanja problema.

input: If you want more probability, they have a really good course on probability, but they've got all sorts of other math and science as well, so you're almost certainly going to find something that interests you.
from_community_srt: Ako želite još vjerojatnosti, oni imaju jako dobar kurs o vjerojatnosti. Ali imaju i mnogo drugih grana matematike i znanosti, tako da ćete zasigurno naći nešto što vas zanima.
